attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Prime Minister Brown, after the demonstrations that followed elections in Iran, declared it is up to the people of Iran to determine who governs their country.

One of the objectives of our troops in Afghanistan was to enable free and fair elections to take place.

In Iraq we have been helping to introduce democratic elections.

Yet Prime Minister Brown has never been elected by the people to be our Prime Minister.

Brown has refused a referendum on the Treaty Of Lisbon, to which his party committed in its manifesto.

There has been little parliamentary debate re the billions he has committed to salvage the country from his current mess. 

Brown is not a democratically elected Prime Minister; he is self-appointed dictator, consistently denying the people of Great Britain our right to elect our leader.
 
We the undersigned demand our democratic right for a free and immediate general election, so we can decide whom we believe to be the right man for the job to lead this once-great country.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
